com.esri.mo2.cs.geom
Class BasePointsArray

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.BaseGeometry
        |
        +--com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.BasePointsArray
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, Geometry, GeometryCollection, HitTest, PointApplicatorUser, PointCollection
Direct Known Subclasses:
MBasePointsArray
public class BasePointsArray
extends BaseGeometry
implements PointCollection

A standard Points implementation that stores one or more points within a pair of coordinate arrays - one array for X ordinates and the other for Y ordinates. This is useful for Dataset implementations that need to quickly populate a Points collection with the coordinates of a shape, having a fixed number of points. It would be less useful for Point collections, such as Editing that are intended to change.

getEnvelopeByRef

public Envelope getEnvelopeByRef()
Description copied from interface: Geometry
Determines the bounding box of the geometry. This method returns a reference to an existing envelope.

This method is provided to reduce memory consumption and should be used with care. Modifications should not be made to the returned envelope. Implementing classes are free to return an actual reference or a completely new object providing it is stated in the method's documentation.

Specified by:
getEnvelopeByRef in interface Geometry
Overrides:
getEnvelopeByRef in class BaseGeometry
Returns:
the envelope bounding box

hitTest

public boolean hitTest(Point pt,
                       double maxDistance,
                       HitResult result)
Description copied from interface: HitTest
Searches for the closest vertex within the specified search radius. If a hit is found, the contents of the HitResult will be updated accordingly. If no hit is found, the contents of the HitResult will be undefined.

Specified by:
hitTest in interface HitTest
Parameters:
pt - the center of the search radius
maxDistance - the maximum distance to consider
result - the vertice which is closest to the query point
Returns:
a boolean value - True if a hit is found, else False

segmentHitTest

public boolean segmentHitTest(Point queryPoint,
                              double maxDistance,
                              SegmentHitResult result,
                              boolean addLastSegment)
Description copied from interface: PointCollection
Finds the closest segment (in an ordered collection) to a query point. If a hit is found, the contents of SegmentHitResult will be updated, else will be undefined.

Specified by:
segmentHitTest in interface PointCollection
Parameters:
queryPoint - the center of the search radius
maxDistance - the maximum distance to consider
result - the start vertex of the segment which is closest the query point
Returns:
a boolean value -True if a hit is found, else False

equals

public boolean equals(Object o)
This method compares the X and Y ordinates of the Points. The Points do not need to be in the exact same order to be equal. MBasePointsArray and MZBasePointsArray use this method as they are subclasses of BasePointsArray.

Overrides:
equals in class Object
Returns:
a boolean value - True if the arrays are equal, else False
See Also:
MBasePointsArray, MZBasePointsArray, Object.equals(java.lang.Object)

addPointsFromCoordinateDefinition

protected void addPointsFromCoordinateDefinition(String coordinateDefinition)
Adds Points, created from corresponding coordinate definition of a coordinates string, to the current BasePointsArray object.

This method can be implemented only if axl.map.Util.currentCs and axl.map.Util.currentTs separators have already been setup properly. Refer com.esri.mo2.axl for more information on how to setup these seperators.
